Author: Lumbi#8378
Content:
`sudo ufw allow 51797 # TXSCLCC
sudo ufw allow 8922 # BEER
sudo ufw allow 11607 # PIZZA
sudo ufw allow 17711 # iguanatestnet`

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: thought it had to be done in fail2ban

Author: Dr.Terminus#3269
Content: no?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: ```Fail2ban scans log files (e.g. /var/log/apache/error_log) and bans IPs that show the malicious signs -- too many password failures, seeking for exploits, etc.```

Author: newvulcan#4719
Content: Are you using ufw @Dr.Terminus  ? Was recommended to me and way better than using iptables to control the firewall. I used getinfo for every chain, made a note of the rcp and p2p ports and allowed them through. There's also a post somewhere on this thread with them listed - have a search for ufw

Author: phm87#7395
Content: for most of the coins I've played with, a remote machine cannot access a coin RPC of another machine except if rpcallowip of the remote machine is into the coin.conf (or as parameter). I though it was the same for komodo. I play a lot with this because my pool is on several VM on several servers

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
` a remote machine cannot access a coin RPC of another machine except if rpcallowip`
that doesn't stop the scripts that people blindly run
